sen.j: 新年宴会（しんねんえんかい）とは、戦前の祝祭日の一つ。
sen.e: Shinnen Enkai is a holiday which used to be celebrated before the War.
Shinnen Enkai is a holiday which used to be celebrated before the World War II.
sen.cmt: a holiday を a national holiday に修正しました。the War を the World War II に修正しました。
sen.e: Shinnen Enkai is a holiday which used to be celebrated before the World War II.
January 5th.
It falls on January 5.
It falls on January 5.

sen.j: 皇族のほか、親任官（大臣 (日本)、高級官僚、軍人など）、外国の公大使などが宮中に招かれ、新年の祝賀として盛大に宴会が行われた。
sen.e: In addition to the Imperial family, officials appointed by the emperor (ministers (Japan), senior government official, military man, etc.) as well as foreign ambassadors were invited to the Imperial court to celebrate the banquet for the New Year on a grand scale.

In addition to the Imperial family, officials appointed by the emperor (ministers [Japan], senior government official, military men, etc.) as well as foreign ambassadors were invited to the Imperial court to celebrate the banquet for the New Year on a grand scale.
sen.cmt: (Japan) を [Japan] に修正しました。military man を military men に修正しました。
sen.e: In addition to the Imperial family, officials appointed by the emperor (ministers [Japan], senior government official, military men, etc.) as well as foreign ambassadors were invited to the Imperial court to celebrate the banquet for the New Year on a grand scale.

sen.j: 民間でもこれに倣って宴会が行われ、新年会のルーツと言われている。
sen.e: Ordinary people had banquets modeling after this practice, which is said to be the origin of today's New Year's party.
sen.cmt: 原文では「新年会」とのみありますが、明確にするため"today's"を補足しました。
sen.e: Ordinary people also held banquets following this custom, which is said to be the origin of today's New Year's party.
sen.cmt: 前半部を全文修正しました。
sen.e: Ordinary people also held banquets following this custom, which is said to be the origin of today's New Year's party.

sen.j: 新年宴会は、奈良時代から宮中で行われていた元日の節会（がんじつのせちえ）に由来するものである。
sen.e: Shinnen Enkai originates from Ganjitsu no Sechi-e (Court ritual of Reception and Audience of Politicians) which used to be held in the Imperial court from Nara period.
Shinnen Enkai originates from Ganjitsu no Sechi-e (Court ritual of Reception and Audience of Politicians) which used to be held in the Imperial court from Nara period.
Shinnen Enkai originates from Ganjitsu no Sechi-e (Court ritual of Reception and Audience of Politicians) which used to be held in the Imperial court from Nara period.

sen.j: 室町時代から中断されていたのを、明治になって再興した。
sen.e: It was not held since Muromachi period but was revived in the Meiji period.
It was not held since the Muromachi period but was revived in the Meiji period.
sen.cmt: Muromachi period に the を追記しました。
sen.e: It was not held since the Muromachi period but was revived in the Meiji period.

sen.j: 元日には宮中で色々な行事が行われることから、1872年（明治5年）より1月5日に移され、「新年宴会」という名称とした。
sen.e: As there are many events taking place on the New Year's day, the banquet was moved to January 5th since 1872 and became to be called "Shinnen Enkai".
As there are many events taking place in the Imperial court on the New Year's day, the banquet was moved to January 5 since 1872 and named "Shinnen Enkai."
As there are many events taking place in the Imperial court on the New Year's day, the banquet was moved to January 5 since 1872 and named "Shinnen Enkai."

sen.j: 1872年から1874年（明治7年）までは1月5日・6日の2日に渡っていたが、1875年（明治8年）から5日のみになった。
sen.e: From 1872 through 1874 it was held over two days from January 5th to 6th, it became one day only on January 5th since 1875.
From 1872 through 1874, it was held over two days from January 5 to 6; however, it was held only one day on January 5 since 1875.
From 1872 through 1874, it was held over two days from January 5 to 6; however, it was held only one day on January 5 since 1875.

sen.j: 事変の勃発により中止される年もあった。
sen.e: It was canceled in some years due to an incident.
It was canceled in some years due to incidents.
sen.cmt: an incident を incidents に修正しました。
sen.e: It was canceled in some years due to incidents.
